revised_title: Copper Springs in County Wicklow: A Detailed Account
tldr: The author, William Henry, provides a detailed account of the copper springs in County Wicklow, Ireland. He describes the process of copper extraction, the role of iron bars in the process, and the resulting copper-mud. He also discusses improvements made to prevent dirt and mud from being carried out of the mines by the streams. This letter was sent to the Right Honorable the Lord Cadogan, F. R. S., and is meant to be considered by the Royal Society.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Geology and Mineralogy
